name: Extended Person Name
description: The XPN data type is used to specify the names of persons. It replaces the PN data type as of HL7 v2.3 and provides comprehensive support for family names, given names, middle names, prefixes, suffixes, and degrees. Supports multiple character sets for international usage and different name representations.

XPN.1.name: Family Name
XPN.1.description: Surname of a person. Allows full specification including differentiation of person's own surname from spouse's surname, and permits distinction of surname prefix (e.g., 'van', 'de') from surname root. If only one name component exists, it is sent in this field.

XPN.2.name: Given Name
XPN.2.description: First name of the person. Also known as the given name or forename.

XPN.3.name: Middle Initial or Name
XPN.3.description: Middle name or middle initial. Multiple middle names may be included by separating them with spaces.

XPN.4.name: Suffix
XPN.4.description: Name suffix (e.g., JR, III, Sr). Used for generational suffixes and other name extensions.

XPN.5.name: Prefix
XPN.5.description: Name prefix or title (e.g., DR, MR, MS). Professional and courtesy titles that precede the name.

XPN.6.name: Degree
XPN.6.description: Academic or professional degree (e.g., MD, PhD, RN). Educational qualifications and professional designations.

XPN.7.name: Name Type Code
XPN.7.description: Code that represents the type of name (e.g., legal name, maiden name, alias). Refer to HL7 Table 0200 - Name Type.

XPN.8.name: Name Representation Code
XPN.8.description: Code that represents how the name is represented (e.g., alphabetic, ideographic, phonetic). Used for international character sets.

constraints.singleName: If person has only one name component, send in XPN.1 (Family Name)
constraints.multipleMiddle: Multiple middle names separated by spaces within XPN.3
constraints.characterSets: Supports switching between alphabetic, ideographic, and phonetic representations

usage: Patient names in PID.5 - Patient Name
Next of kin names in NK1.2 - Name
Guarantor names in GT1.3 - Guarantor Name
Any person name throughout HL7 messages

generationHints.typical: Use realistic names appropriate for healthcare demographics

internationalSupport.description: Supports multiple character sets and name representations for international usage
internationalSupport.characterSets: JIS X 0202 - ISO 2022 provides escape sequences for switching character sets
internationalSupport.repetitions: Name field may be repeated for different character set representations

examples.japanese: Supports both Kanji (ideographic) and Romaji (alphabetic) representations
examples.arabic: Supports both Arabic script and Latin transliteration
examples.chinese: Supports traditional/simplified Chinese and Pinyin representations
